article_title: Indian Police Seize U.S. Maritime Security Company AdvanFort's Ship; File Complaint Against Crew, Security Guards
article_text:
Indian police seized the Seaman Guard Ohio, a Sierra Leone-registered ship operated by Virginia anti-piracy company AdvanFort, and filed a complaint Monday against the ship's 35 crewmembers and security guards for failing to produce papers authorizing them to carry arms in Indian waters.

"We gave them 24 hours, but they were unable to produce the necessary documentation for the weapons," said M. Manohar, a superintendent of...

twitter.description: Indian police seized a Virginia maritime anti-piracy company ship Monday. The country has filed a complaint against the 35 crew and security guards aboard the Seaman Guard Ohio, operated by AdvanFort for failing to produce papers authorizing them to carry arms in Indian waters.The ship was intercepted some 15 nautical miles off the southern coast of India and is being held in the port of Tuticorin.
twitter.creator: @NiharikaSM

image.alt: Indian Police Seize U.S. Maritime Security Company AdvanFort's Ship; File Complaint Against Crew, Security Guards

twitter.title: India Seizes U.S. Maritime Security Ship
